Dispute_Type: Application refusal based on language proficiency assessment
Legal_Issue: Whether the officer erred in assessing language proficiency beyond AEO requirements
Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA) and its Regulations
Evidence_Type: Language proficiency evidence, Arranged Employment Opinion (AEO)
Legal_Provision: IRPA and associated regulations regarding foreign worker qualifications
Basis_of_Claim: Officer imposed higher language standard than specified in AEO
Evaluation_Standard: Reasonableness and correctness standards in judicial review
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Officer's imposition of reading and writing requirements not in AEO
Regulation_Cited: IRPA Regulations related to arranged employment and language requirements
Application_Error: Imposing additional language requirements (reading/writing) not specified in AEO
Assessment_Standard: Basic English oral proficiency as per AEO
Evidence_Ignored: Applicantâ€™s demonstrated oral proficiency consistent with AEO
Legal_Standard: Statutory compliance with IRPA and policy guidelines
Decision_Outcome: Remitted for redetermination by a different officer
Decision_Review_Issue: Error in applying incorrect language proficiency standard
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: AEO terms and IRPA regulatory requirements for language ability
Cause_of_Refusal: Perceived insufficient English proficiency beyond AEO requirements
Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA sections related to permanent residence and arranged employment
Evidentiary_Issues: Mismatch between required and assessed language skills
Procedural_Fairness: Officer failed to adhere to procedural fairness by adding unstated criteria
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge based on statutory interpretation and procedural fairness
Procedural_Issue: Improper enhancement of language requirements without basis in AEO
